page.title: 16Town Twinning - Cockermouth
page.content: In 1983 Cockermouth was 'twinned' with Marvejols, of similar population in the Lozere Department of France. Marvejols is a market town with agricultural, forestry and quarrying interests. Initial Town Council contacts resulted in reciprocal visits by secondary school students and mental hospital staff and patients. West Cumbria College students have visited France for work experience and the Cockermouth Mechanic's Band has performed there. Many informal visits have been made to Cockermouth and Marvejols and in 1985 a party will visit France to celebrate the second anniversary. Planned events include a second visit by the Mechanic's Band, a visit by the "Majorettes" (a marching band) for the Cockermouth Carnival in 1986 and exchange visits by sports teams.
